groundTruth.text: AbstractService providers provision more and more Internet-of-Things (IoT) services in the cloud for dynamicity and cost-effectiveness purposes. This is made possible thanks to the introduction of edge computing that brings additional computing and resources for analytics close to the data sources and thus enables meeting the low latency requirement. Edge nodes should support (i) the heterogeneity of IoT devices (e.g., sensor, actuator) and (ii) characteristics (e.g., mobility, location awareness). IoT is already integrated to the hybrid cloud/edge environment. However, the ecosystem lacks of automation due to the previously mentioned characteristics. Indeed, edge nodes are often manually selected during deployment time, and most of the regular quality-of-service (QoS) management procedures remain difficult to implement. This paper introduces a comprehensive semantic model called EdgeOnto. It encompasses all concepts related to IoT applied in the context of edge computing. The ultimate goal of EdgeOnto is to automate the several steps that make up the IoT services lifecycle in hybrid cloud/edge environment. On the one hand, semantics enable an automatic discovery of the relevant edge nodes that are suitable to host and execute IoT services considering their requirements. On the other hand, it allows supporting the specific QoS procedures that are related to such setting (e.g., low latency, mobility, jitter). The core ontology was designed with the Protégé open-source tool. A smart strawberry farming use case was implemented and evaluated for illustration purposes. The results validate the accuracy and the precision of the designed semantic matchmaker.

problem.title: Automating IoT Service Lifecycle Management in Hybrid Cloud-Edge Environments
problem.description: The lack of automation in dynamically managing the lifecycle of IoT services across heterogeneous edge and cloud environments, particularly due to (i) the diversity of IoT devices and their characteristics (e.g., mobility, location awareness) and (ii) the need to meet stringent quality-of-service (QoS) requirements (e.g., low latency, jitter). This challenge extends to any distributed computing system where resource allocation, service deployment, and QoS management must adapt to dynamic, heterogeneous, and resource-constrained environments.

templateData.title: Automated IoT Service Lifecycle Management in Hybrid Cloud-Edge Environments
templateData.description: Technical framework for evaluating automation solutions in dynamically managing IoT service lifecycles across heterogeneous cloud-edge infrastructures, emphasizing QoS optimization, resource allocation, and adaptive deployment strategies under constrained conditions

templateProperty.label: Problem Scope Definition
templateProperty.description: Detailed technical description of the IoT service lifecycle management challenges in hybrid environments, including device heterogeneity, mobility patterns, and QoS constraints

templateProperty.label: System Architecture
templateProperty.description: Named architecture or framework used (e.g., Kubernetes-based, Serverless, Microservices) with justification for hybrid cloud-edge deployment

templateProperty.label: Automation Framework
templateProperty.description: Specific tool or framework used for lifecycle automation (e.g., Terraform, Ansible, Knative, Custom Controller)

templateProperty.label: QoS Metrics Tracked
templateProperty.description: List of quantitative QoS metrics monitored (e.g., latency, jitter, throughput, packet loss) with target thresholds

templateProperty.label: End-to-End Latency Budget (ms)
templateProperty.description: Maximum allowable latency for critical IoT service operations in milliseconds

templateProperty.label: Edge Resource Constraints
templateProperty.description: Quantitative constraints of edge devices (CPU, memory, storage, bandwidth) in standardized units (e.g., vCPUs, GB, Mbps)

templateProperty.label: Dynamic Deployment Strategy
templateProperty.description: Technical approach for adaptive service deployment (e.g., rule-based, ML-driven, reinforcement learning, heuristic optimization)

templateProperty.label: Orchestration Tool
templateProperty.description: Primary tool used for service orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, Nomad, OpenStack)

templateProperty.label: Mobility Handling Mechanism
templateProperty.description: Technical method for managing device mobility (e.g., handoff protocols, location-aware scheduling, predictive migration)

templateProperty.label: Benchmark Dataset/Workload
templateProperty.description: Standardized dataset or synthetic workload used for evaluation (e.g., IoT-Dataset, custom traces, EdgeNet)

templateProperty.label: Primary Evaluation Metrics
templateProperty.description: Key performance metrics reported (e.g., automation overhead, SLA compliance rate, resource utilization efficiency)

templateProperty.label: SLA Compliance Rate (%)
templateProperty.description: Percentage of service-level agreements (SLAs) met during evaluation

templateProperty.label: Automation Overhead (ms)
templateProperty.description: Additional latency introduced by automation logic, measured in milliseconds

templateProperty.label: Resource Utilization Efficiency (%)
templateProperty.description: Percentage of allocated resources effectively utilized (higher = better)

templateProperty.label: Scalability Test Results
templateProperty.description: Performance degradation metrics when scaling from X to Y devices/services (e.g., 'Latency increase: 10ms per 100 devices')

templateProperty.label: Fault Tolerance Mechanism
templateProperty.description: Technical approach for handling failures (e.g., checkpointing, replication, self-healing, fallback policies)

templateProperty.label: Security Protocols Implemented
templateProperty.description: List of security measures (e.g., TLS 1.3, OAuth2, Zero Trust, Edge-specific encryption)

templateProperty.label: Comparative Frameworks
templateProperty.description: Named alternative frameworks/tools compared against in evaluation (e.g., Kubernetes vs. Nomad, Terraform vs. Pulumi)

templateProperty.label: Implementation Repository
templateProperty.description: Publicly accessible URL to source code or prototype implementation

templateProperty.label: Publication/Implementation Date
templateProperty.description: Date when the research was published or the system was deployed (YYYY-MM-DD)

templateProperty.label: Cost Analysis
templateProperty.description: Quantitative cost comparison (e.g., cloud vs. edge operational costs, $/hour/device, cost savings from automation)

templateProperty.label: Adaptation Algorithm
templateProperty.description: Specific algorithm used for dynamic adaptation (e.g., Q-Learning, Genetic Algorithm, Gradient Descent, Custom Heuristic)

templateProperty.label: Real-World Deployment Status
templateProperty.description: Description of any real-world deployments (e.g., 'Deployed in 3 smart cities, 500+ devices')

impact.comments: This tool would facilitate extraction of information from papers
